title: Language-Based Curriculum Improvement Design for HRD Professionals' Competency Strengthening

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level knowledge and experience in solving complex problems, proficiency in HRD-specific terminology and report writing
context.additional_context: Requires strengthening job relevance for adult learners and establishing a real-time feedback-based educational environment, with a particular focus on improving language-based job competencies such as business document writing and presentations.

learning_goals: Learners can improve HRD core competencies (instructional design, coaching skills, etc.) to a level applicable in simulation environments by at least 80% and strengthen effective expression skills using professional terminology and communication techniques
Learners can perform competency gap analysis in VR scenarios simulating real organizational environments, document analysis results in structured report format, and clearly present improvement plans

Learners can prepare a design plan meeting at least four of the five provided assessment rubric items when designing HRD programs, receive specific feedback from three peers and one expert, and submit a revised final draft. Critical reading and persuasive writing skills are utilized in this process
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
